OOC: Okay, I am confused.

 Sandy I am not trying to be critical, so please=
 don't take it that way, but
your post is sort of unfair. You start your po=
st with Tuscon in the middle
of a very tense stand off with him being defen=
sless and you end it with him
being on the way to the Ark.  Basically you m=
ade no allowance for someone,
presumably Hydras, to stop Tuscon from leavin=
g - which is what most evil bad
guys would do.

In message #70973 the deman=
d was that the Maximals and Autobots lay down
thier weapons if they wanted =
Nightlight to live.

In message #70975 Tuscon gives the order for all the M=
aximals and such to
comply. And in that post you write that Night Shift sub=
spaces his weapon, as
Straight Shot transforms into her robot mode, disarmi=
ng her own weaponry as
well.

In message #70978 Tuscon lays down his weapon=
 and in Message #70987 Kup and
Talon do the same.

This would mean that all=
 of the Maximals and Autobots in that area are now
weaponless, and so prett=
y much defenceless. At the same time much of the
Predacon army is standing =
there, either in front of them, or flying over
head. I had posted that the =
preds were picking up those discarded weapons
while other were watching.

H=
owever in message #70988 Tuscon is able to pick up a weapon, aim it at
some=
one, then with the help of the other Maximals choose not to fire, they
are =
able to talk back and forth a few times, salute each other and then
Tuscon =
drives off with no one stopping him.

How do we reconcile all of that? Sinc=
e you already had Tuscon sending
messages out and your characters already r=
esponding, if we had someone stop
you in the middle of all of that, it woul=
d make it confusing as to what
happened and what didn't.

Tuscon should not=
 have been able to point a weapon, talk, transform and
drive away with no r=
esponse. Does that make sense? Anything we post in the
middle of that would=
 only confuse things worse.

We might need some editing. Like Tuscon just d=
oes the first part of that,
but not leave yet. Allow the rest of us to post=
 a response first, then if it
is reasonable based on the responses he leave=
s?

Again, not trying to to be critical, but keeping it fair.

Preston




=
On Sat, Jan 22, 2011 at 7:58 AM, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:

>
>

> BIC:
>
> Tucson first hears Noctorro's message. He=
 knew he would have to send him a

ge, was the same message Rodimus had

ght our Darkest Hour."

all thrilled with the

s, clench up tightly as

st. This often happened

othing to ignite. Night

to happen. They knew his

=

nd a

>

=

Umm,

t about
> ta erupt, big time. OOH SCRAP, HE'S TAKEN UP ONE OF HIS MISSILE C=
ARRIERS!
> TUCSON NO!"
>
> Tucson eyes his adversaries, while aiming his le=
ft missile carrier toward
> them. He hears Straight Shot, and then realizes=
 exactly what would happen if

teeth, and decides against it.
> The carrier is lowered.
>

ghs in relief.
>
> " Thank Primus. Tucson, sir, don't scare us like that."
=

>
> "I didn't mean to. Something just came over me. Yet, =
I am still not happy
> with Legacy's response. I have to get back to the Ar=
k before someone there
> is harmed."
>
> Night Shift nodds.
>
> " I think w=
e can handle things here. Rodimus should be on his way, and I'm
> sure he's=
 gonna bring help. Go on, you got an Ark ta save."
>
> He salutes Tucson.
>=

> Tucson looks back to his adversaries.
>
> " Even though I'd like nothing=
 better than to vanquish your evil hold on
> this planet, I've come to real=
ize that a far more critical situation has
> just arrisen. I am not giving =
up in cowardice, and this is NOT the last you
> will see or hear of me."
>
=
> He transforms into his truck mode, and then pivots his many wheels, puts
=
> himself in reverse to make a swing around, as back up signals sound, to
>=
 safely bring his trailer around without touching anyone or anything. Then =
a
> hiss of his hydraulics and he rolls away toward the Ark.
>
> "Rodimus, =
the situation at the Ark has escalated. I am heading back to
> ensure the s=
aftey of our comrades, and to personally oust Legacy myself. And
> as for y=
our assistance, I thank you profusely for your efforts. By the way,
> this =
is the part where you take my place and win the war."
>
> With that transmi=
tted, Tucson accerates as he kicks up dirt under his
> enormous tires. Now =
thinking about Legacy, was turning on the short fuse
> once again. He sends=
 another message.
>
> "You leave me no choice Legacy. No choice but to oust=
 you myself. Keep in
> mind that you have but a limited time to change your=
 mind and comply with my
> demands! And if anyone is harmed in the mean tim=
e, I WILL GIVE TO YOU WHICH
> YOU GIVE TO THEM!"
>
> Outside, with Quickstr=
ide and Rodimus, Uproar trots over to them, and lies
> down in the grasses.=

>
> " I'm sorry, I lost it for a minute there.. Okay, you need help, I'm i=
n,
> definitely. Whatever you want I'll do it."
>
> Quickstride could not h=
elp but intercept Tucson's message.
>
> "Uh ohh, ohhhh boy. I hate that I'm=
 able ta do this. My ears just caught a
> transmission from Tucson Prime. H=
e's heading back, and judging by the tone
> of his voice, he's in a beast o=
f a mood. Said someth'n about ousting Legacy
> the hard way. I hate ta see =
what that entails.."
>
> Uproar grins kiddingly.
>
> "And I thought my temp=
er was nasty. Sounds like he's got a shorter fuse
> than I do. Think we can=
 stick around'n watch him throttle that Legacy guy?"
>
> He says with a cat=
 like grin.
>

<div>OOC: Okay, I am confused.=A0=A0</div>
<div>=A0</div>
<div>
<div>Sandy =
I am not trying to be critical, so please don't take it that way, but y=
our post is sort of unfair.=A0You start your post with Tuscon in the middle=
 of a very tense stand off with him being defensless and you end it=A0with =
him being on the way to the Ark.=A0 Basically you made no allowance for som=
eone, presumably Hydras, to stop Tuscon from leaving - which is what most e=
vil bad guys would do. </div>
</div>
<div>=A0</div>
<div>In message #70973 =
the demand was that the Maximals and Autobots lay down thier weapons if the=
y wanted Nightlight to live. </div>
<div>=A0</div>
<div>In message #70975 T=
uscon gives the order for all the Maximals and such to comply. And in that =
post you write that Night Shift subspaces his weapon, as Straight Shot tran=
sforms into her robot mode, disarming her own weaponry as well. </div>

<di=
v>=A0</div>
<div>In message #70978 Tuscon lays down his weapon and in Messa=
ge #70987 Kup and Talon do the same.</div>
<div>=A0</div>
<div>This would m=
ean that all of the Maximals and Autobots in that area are now weaponless, =
and so pretty much defenceless. At the same time much of the Predacon army =
is standing there, either in front of them,=A0or flying over head. I had po=
sted that the preds were picking up those discarded weapons while other wer=
e watching. </div>

<div>=A0</div>
<div>However in message #70988 Tuscon is=
 able to pick up a weapon, aim it at someone, then with the help of the oth=
er Maximals choose not to fire, they are able to talk back and forth a few =
times, salute each other and then Tuscon drives off with no one stopping hi=
m. </div>

<div>=A0</div>
<div>How do we reconcile all of that? Since you a=
lready had Tuscon sending messages out and your characters already respondi=
ng, if we had someone stop you in the middle of all of that, it would make =
it confusing as to what happened and what didn't. </div>

<div>=A0</div=
>
<div>Tuscon should not have been able to point a weapon, talk, transform =
and drive away with no response. Does that make sense? Anything we post in =
the middle of that would only confuse things worse.</div>
<div>=A0</div>
<d=
iv>We might need some editing. Like Tuscon just does the first part of that=
, but not leave yet. Allow the rest of us to post a response first, then if=
 it is reasonable based on the responses he leaves? </div>
<div>=A0</div>
<=
div>Again, not trying to to be critical, but keeping it fair. </div>
<div>=
=A0</div>
<div>Preston</div>
<div><br><br><br>=A0</div>

<div =
style=3D"BACKGROUND-COLOR: #fff"><span>=A0</span> 
<div>
<div>
<div>
<p>OOC=
: I did an edit but I guess I'll add Uproar back in. I'll get his p=
rofile up again soon. <br><br>BIC:<br><br>Tucson first hears Noctorro's=
 message. He knew he would have to send him a signal, and the best one to h=
is knowledge, was the same message Rodimus had given, when activating the m=
atrix. So, quietly to Noctorro himself, he sends this com link, silently.<b=
r>
<br>"Light our Darkest Hour."<br><br>Then, he recieves Legacy&=
#39;s transmission. Not at all thrilled with the results of course. His eye=
s narrow coldly. His fists, clench up tightly as those all wheel drive syst=
ems begin to kick in fast. This often happened when he lost his temper, and=
 a short fuse takes nothing to ignite. Night Shift and Straight Shot could =
see what was about to happen. They knew his expression all too well. They l=
ook back to Kup.<br>
<br>" I know that look on his face Kup, that'=
s not good.. Straight Shot, send a message ta Rodimus."<br><br>Straigh=
t Shot nodds and sends her message.<br><br>"Rodimus, we got a major pr=
oblemo here.. Remember Tucson's short fuse? Umm, well, that's commi=
ng back, with a vengeance.. He looks like he's just about ta erupt, big=
 time. OOH SCRAP, HE'S TAKEN UP ONE OF HIS MISSILE CARRIERS! TUCSON NO!=
"<br>
<br>Tucson eyes his adversaries, while aiming his left missile c=
arrier toward them. He hears Straight Shot, and then realizes exactly what =
would happen if he were to fire that missile. He grits his teeth, and decid=
es against it. The carrier is lowered.<br>
<br>Night Shift sighs in relief.=
<br><br>" Thank Primus. Tucson, sir, don't scare us like that.&quo=
t;<br><br>Tucson nodds.<br><br>"I didn't mean to. Something just c=
ame over me. Yet, I am still not happy with Legacy's response. I have t=
o get back to the Ark before someone there is harmed."<br>
<br>Night S=
hift nodds.<br><br>" I think we can handle things here. Rodimus should=
 be on his way, and I'm sure he's gonna bring help. Go on, you got =
an Ark ta save."<br><br>He salutes Tucson.<br><br>Tucson looks back to=
 his adversaries.<br>
<br>" Even though I'd like nothing better th=
an to vanquish your evil hold on this planet, I've come to realize that=
 a far more critical situation has just arrisen. I am not giving up in cowa=
rdice, and this is NOT the last you will see or hear of me." <br>
<br>=
He transforms into his truck mode, and then pivots his many wheels, puts hi=
mself in reverse to make a swing around, as back up signals sound, to safel=
y bring his trailer around without touching anyone or anything. Then a hiss=
 of his hydraulics and he rolls away toward the Ark.<br>
<br>"Rodimus,=
 the situation at the Ark has escalated. I am heading back to ensure the sa=
ftey of our comrades, and to personally oust Legacy myself. And as for your=
 assistance, I thank you profusely for your efforts. By the way, this is th=
e part where you take my place and win the war."<br>
<br>With that tra=
nsmitted, Tucson accerates as he kicks up dirt under his enormous tires. No=
w thinking about Legacy, was turning on the short fuse once again. He sends=
 another message.<br><br>"You leave me no choice Legacy. No choice but=
 to oust you myself. Keep in mind that you have but a limited time to chang=
e your mind and comply with my demands! And if anyone is harmed in the mean=
 time, I WILL GIVE TO YOU WHICH YOU GIVE TO THEM!" <br>
<br>Outside, w=
ith Quickstride and Rodimus, Uproar trots over to them, and lies down in th=
e grasses.<br><br>" I'm sorry, I lost it for a minute there.. Okay=
, you need help, I'm in, definitely. Whatever you want I'll do it.&=
quot;<br>
<br>Quickstride could not help but intercept Tucson's message=
.<br><br>"Uh ohh, ohhhh boy. I hate that I'm able ta do this. My e=
ars just caught a transmission from Tucson Prime. He's heading back, an=
d judging by the tone of his voice, he's in a beast of a mood. Said som=
eth'n about ousting Legacy the hard way. I hate ta see what that entail=
s.."<br>
<br>Uproar grins kiddingly.<br><br>"And I thought my tem=
per was nasty. Sounds like he's got a shorter fuse than I do. Think we =
can stick around'n watch him throttle that Legacy guy?"<br><br>He =
says with a cat like grin.
